message:
[Action Options]
1) PICK <obj>, Only PICK if gripper is empty. PICK only the correct next item according to the recipe.
2) PUT <obj1> <obj2>. <obj1> can be one of the foods. <obj2> can be food, cutting_board, or table.
3) WAIT, do nothing.
Only one robot can PUT each round. You must PICK up an item before PUT.
[Action Output Instruction]
Think step-by-step about your plan and output your idea, and then output 'EXECUTE
', then give exactly one action per robot, put each on a new line.
Example#1:Think: Dave, please PICK cheese. I will WAIT this round.
Action: EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PICK cheese
Example#2:Think: Alright, Chad,I will PUT cheese on the cucumber and you can PICK ham this round.
Action: EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK ham
NAME Dave ACTION PUT cheese cucumber
[Task Description]
Robot Chad and Dave need collaborate to make a [big_sandwich] as quickly as possible.
Robot Chad can only take the food on the right, and Dave can only take the food on the left.
Food items must be stacked following this order: bread_slice1, tomato2, cheese, beef_patty2, ham, cucumber1, bacon, beef_patty1, bread_slice2, where bread_slice1 must be PUT on cutting_board. 
Please output the actions most suitable for robots Chad and Dave to complete this task.
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].
Respond very concisely but informatively.
Propose exactly one action per robot at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!

== Round#1 ==
[Env state]: 
bread_slice1: on left side
bread_slice2: on left side
bacon: on left side
cheese: on left side
tomato1: on left side
ham: on left side
beef_patty1: on right side
cucumber2: on right side
beef_patty2: on right side
tomato2: on right side
cucumber1: on right side
[Agent state]: 
Chad's gripper is empty
Dave's gripper is empty
[Response]: 
Think: Dave should PICK bread_slice1 and Chad should PICK tomato2 since these are the first two items needed for the big_sandwich.
Action: EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION PICK tomato2
NAME Dave ACTION PICK bread_slice1
[Feedback]: 
None
At the current round:
[Env State]
bread_slice2: on left side
bacon: on left side
cheese: on left side
tomato1: on left side
ham: on left side
beef_patty1: on right side
cucumber2: on right side
beef_patty2: on right side

cucumber1: on right side
[Agent State]
Chad's gripper is holding tomato2
Dave's gripper is holding bread_slice1

Think about the task at hand and plan actions for all agents in ['Chad', 'Dave'], and output exactly in the format of the given case.
Your answer is:

Think: Dave should PUT bread_slice1 on the cutting_board, and Chad should WAIT because he can't put tomato2 on anything yet.
Action: EXECUTE
NAME Chad ACTION WAIT
NAME Dave ACTION PUT bread_slice1 cutting_board
